meanings.definition: To make someone feel uneasy or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise discomforted the dog.
meanings.sent2: The unfamiliar surroundings discomforted the child.
meanings.sent3: The thought of spiders made him discomforted.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds discomforted her like a looming storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the abandoned house discomforted him deeply.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel physical pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The tight shoes discomforted her toes.
meanings.sent2: The heavy backpack discomforted his shoulders.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much ice cream discomforted his stomach.
meanings.sent4: The sharp rock discomforted his bare feet.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy fabric discomforted her skin.
